trans-unit.source: The SIGN function returns the sign of the specified number.

seg-source.mrk: The SIGN function returns the sign of the specified number.

target.mrk: The SIGN function returns the sign of the specified number.

trans-unit.source: The specified number is the number you want the sign of. The specified number must be a <xref href="rrefsqljdoubleprecision.dita#rrefsqljdoubleprecision">DOUBLE PRECISION</xref> number.

seg-source.mrk: The specified number is the number you want the sign of.
The specified number must be a <xref href="rrefsqljdoubleprecision.dita#rrefsqljdoubleprecision">DOUBLE PRECISION</xref> number.

target.mrk: The specified number is the number you want the sign of.
The specified number must be a <xref href="rrefsqljdoubleprecision.dita#rrefsqljdoubleprecision">DOUBLE PRECISION</xref> number.

trans-unit.source: The data type of the returned value is <xref href="rrefsqlj10696.dita#rrefsqlj10696">INTEGER</xref>.

seg-source.mrk: The data type of the returned value is <xref href="rrefsqlj10696.dita#rrefsqlj10696">INTEGER</xref>.

target.mrk: The data type of the returned value is <xref href="rrefsqlj10696.dita#rrefsqlj10696">INTEGER</xref>.

trans-unit.source: If the specified number is NULL, the result of this function is NULL.

seg-source.mrk: If the specified number is NULL, the result of this function is NULL.

target.mrk: If the specified number is NULL, the result of this function is NULL.

trans-unit.source: If the specified number is zero (0), the result of this function is zero (0).

seg-source.mrk: If the specified number is zero (0), the result of this function is zero (0).

target.mrk: If the specified number is zero (0), the result of this function is zero (0).

trans-unit.source: If the specified number is greater than zero (0), the result of this function is plus one (+1).

seg-source.mrk: If the specified number is greater than zero (0), the result of this function is plus one (+1).

target.mrk: If the specified number is greater than zero (0), the result of this function is plus one (+1).

trans-unit.source: If the specified number is less than zero (0), the result of this function is minus one (-1).

seg-source.mrk: If the specified number is less than zero (0), the result of this function is minus one (-1).

target.mrk: If the specified number is less than zero (0), the result of this function is minus one (-1).
